intro: Dyschoriste hildebrandtii var. occidentalis, commonly known as the western dyschoriste, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator of ecological health.
